content: Investments Stocks Asked by AnonymousAsked on 01 Sep 2019Hi everyone! Is it possible for me to sell some SGX stocks (bought using DBS Vickers cash upfront account) through my Standard Chartered trading account?Thinking if it's possible to do so since the fees for Standard Chartered are lower. Thank you!1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Gabriel Tham, Tag Team Member at Kenichi Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 03 Sep 2019No, that is not possible.Standard Chartered is a custodian account and is not linked to CDP.DBS is linked to CDP.If you would like to enjoy lower fees for SELLING of shares kept in CDP, you can use FSMONE.0 comments0
